regulationsummary: The Ordinance establishes comprehensive antimoney laundering and counterterrorist financing obligations for financial institutions, insurers, money service operators, virtual asset service providers, and other designated nonfinancial businesses It requires customer due diligence CDD, recordkeeping for highvalue storedvalue facilities, and enhanced due diligence EDD for specified highrisk DNFBPs The Ordinance empowers relevant authorities to supervise compliance, conduct inspections, and enforce penalties, while providing guidelines to clarify operational requirements It also sets out procedures for investigations, evidence handling, and crossjurisdictional cooperation on virtual asset activities Noncompliance can lead to substantial fines, imprisonment, and disciplinary actions

actionablerules.obligation: Collect and verify the identity of every customer, the source of funds, and the purpose of the transaction before opening an account or providing a service
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All financial institutions, insurers, licensed money service operators, licensed VAS providers, TCSP licensees, and Category B PMS registrants
risksignalstomonitor: Customers who provide anonymous or incomplete identification documents
Transactions involving unusually large amounts or rapid movement of funds
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Copy of governmentissued ID or passport
Proof of address utility bill, bank statement
Source of funds documentation salary slips, business invoices
Internal CDD policy and training records
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  if the customer is a highrisk individual or the transaction involves highrisk jurisdictions, complex ownership structures, or is otherwise suspicious

actionablerules.obligation: Maintain complete records of all storedvalue facility transactions where the maximum value stored exceeds HK3,000 and the value is stored on a physical device
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: SVF licensees and banks operating storedvalue facilities
risksignalstomonitor: Frequent cash deposits or withdrawals exceeding HK3,000
Multiple small deposits that aggregate to a large amount structuring
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Transaction logs with customer details, date, amount, and purpose
Device serial numbers and ownership records
Periodic audit reports of storedvalue balances
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  standard recordkeeping suffices EDD is triggered only if the transaction is otherwise suspicious

actionablerules.obligation: Apply enhanced due diligence to DNFBPs when they conduct transactions involving real estate, securities, trust or company services, or other highrisk activities
whoitappliesto: Licensed individual insurance agents, insurance agencies, and insurance broker companies
Licensed VAS providers and their associated entities
risksignalstomonitor: Transactions involving offshore entities or shell companies
Complex ownership structures with no clear beneficial owner
Highvalue transactions with no clear economic rationale
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Beneficial ownership statements
Detailed transaction purpose and source of funds
Periodic review of the DNFBPs client base and transaction patterns
Internal EDD policy and audit trail
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  EDD is mandatory for all DNFBPs when they are involved in the specified highrisk transactions

actionablerules.obligation: Flag and investigate any transaction that is unusual, involves highrisk jurisdictions, or shows structuring or rapid movement of funds
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All regulated entities subject to the Ordinance
risksignalstomonitor: Structuring smurfing of deposits or withdrawals
Rapid transfer of funds between accounts or jurisdictions
Transactions with no clear business or economic purpose
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Suspicious transaction reports STRs filed with the relevant authority
Internal investigation logs and findings
Evidence of source of funds and transaction purpose
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  if the transaction is flagged as suspicious, EDD must be performed on the customer and the transaction

actionablerules.obligation: Implement and maintain policies and procedures that incorporate any guidelines issued by the Monetary Authority, Securities and Futures Commission, Insurance Authority, or other relevant regulatory bodies
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All regulated entities covered by the Ordinance
risksignalstomonitor: Noncompliance with published guidelines
Lack of documented policies or outdated procedures
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Copies of all relevant guidelines and the institutions internal policy documents
Records of staff training on guidelines
Audit reports confirming adherence to guidelines
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  this rule governs standard compliance EDD is triggered by other risk indicators

actionablerules.obligation: Cooperate with investigations, provide requested records, and pay any pecuniary penalties imposed by relevant authorities
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All regulated entities, including financial institutions, insurers, VAS providers, and DNFBPs
risksignalstomonitor: Failure to respond to inspection requests
Refusal to provide required records
Nonpayment of imposed penalties
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Acknowledgement of inspection or investigation requests
Copies of records produced to investigators
Payment receipts for any fines or penalties
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  this rule addresses enforcement and compliance, not due diligence

actionablerules.obligation: Before granting a licence, the regulator must confirm that the applicant and any ultimate owner are fit and proper persons, based on criminal, financial, and compliance criteria
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All individuals, partnerships, and corporations applying for a money service licence
risksignalstomonitor: Criminal convictions related to money laundering, fraud, or corruption
Bankruptcy or liquidation status
Past regulatory noncompliance or penalties
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Criminal record checks for applicant and ultimate owners
Financial statements and proof of solvency
Evidence of compliance with previous licences or regulations
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  if the ultimate owner is foreign, politically exposed, or otherwise highrisk, the regulator must conduct enhanced due diligence

actionablerules.obligation: Licensees must apply for licence renewal at least 45 days before expiry and submit the required form, fee, and updated information
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All licence holders of money services
risksignalstomonitor: Late renewal applications
Missing or outdated information in renewal application
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Renewal application form
Renewal fee payment
Updated fitandproper documentation if any changes
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  standard renewal checks apply unless there are changes to ultimate owners or business activities

actionablerules.obligation: Licensees must notify the regulator in writing of any change to their particulars eg, address, ownership, business activities within one month of the change
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All licence holders
risksignalstomonitor: Unreported changes to premises or ownership
Delays in notifying the regulator
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Written notification form
Supporting documents evidencing the change
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  routine update however, if the change involves a new ultimate owner, fitandproper checks must be repeated

actionablerules.obligation: If the regulator decides to revoke or suspend a licence, it must first give the licensee a reasonable opportunity to be heard and then issue a written notice that includes reasons, the duration of suspension if applicable, and the right to appeal
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All licence holders
risksignalstomonitor: Noncompliance with licence conditions
Regulatory breaches or criminal activity
Failure to respond to regulatory inquiries
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Notice of decision with reasons
Record of hearing or opportunity to be heard
Documentation of any remedial actions required
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  this is a disciplinary procedure, not a duediligence assessment

actionablerules.obligation: When a licensee adds new premises or changes business activities, it must obtain written approval from the regulator and ensure the premises are suitable and occupants have provided consent
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All licence holders seeking to expand or change premises
risksignalstomonitor: Operating from unapproved premises
Lack of occupant consent
Premises unsuitable for money services
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Application for new premises
Proof of suitability eg, site plan, security assessment
Written consent from all occupants
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  the approval process is procedural however, if the new premises are in a highrisk jurisdiction, additional EDD may be warranted

actionablerules.obligation: A corporation must apply for a licence to provide a VA service only if it is a fit and proper person, has at least two approved responsible officers one of whom is an executive director, and has an approved premises for keeping records
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Corporate applicants for VA service licences
risksignalstomonitor: Application from a corporation that is not a company under the Companies Ordinance
Missing or unapproved responsible officers in the application
Premises not approved by the Commission
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Fit and proper assessment report
List of responsible officers with approval certificates
Premises approval notice from the Commission
Proof of payment of prescribed fee
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  the fit and proper assessment must include enhanced due diligence on the corporations directors, ultimate owners, and financial standing

actionablerules.obligation: Every responsible officer of a licensed provider must be approved by the Commission, have sufficient authority within the provider, and be a fit and proper person
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Responsible officers of licensed VA providers
risksignalstomonitor: Unapproved or unfit individuals listed as responsible officers
Responsible officers lacking documented authority
Responsible officers who are not resident in Hong Kong
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Approval certificate from the Commission
Letter of authority from the provider
Proof of Hong Kong residency eg, address, ID
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  the Commission must conduct enhanced due diligence on each responsible officers background, including criminal history and financial integrity

actionablerules.obligation: An ultimate owner of a licensed provider must obtain written approval from the Commission before becoming an ultimate owner and must keep the Commission informed of any changes to their contact details within 7 business days
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Ultimate owners of licensed VA providers
risksignalstomonitor: Unapproved ultimate owners listed in the providers records
Changes to ultimate owner details not reported within 7 days
Ultimate owners with a history of moneylaundering or terrorist financing offences
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Written approval notice from the Commission
Updated contact details address, phone, email
Fit and proper assessment for the ultimate owner
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  enhanced due diligence is required on the ultimate owners identity, ownership structure, and criminal record

actionablerules.obligation: Client assets held by a licensed provider or its associated entities must be kept separate from the providers own assets and cannot be used to satisfy any court order or execution against the provider
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Licensed VA providers and their associated entities
risksignalstomonitor: Mixing of client assets with company assets in accounting records
Use of client assets to settle debts or obligations of the provider
Failure to maintain separate custody accounts
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Segregated custody account statements
Internal control procedures for client asset segregation
Audit trail of all client asset movements
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  the provider must perform enhanced due diligence on the source of client assets and monitor for suspicious transfers

actionablerules.obligation: A licensed provider must keep all records or documents required under the Ordinance only at premises approved by the Commission
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Licensed VA providers
risksignalstomonitor: Use of nonapproved premises for record keeping
Inadequate security controls at approved premises
Failure to update the register with approved premises details
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Premises approval notice from the Commission
Security and access control logs for the premises
Regular audit reports on premises compliance
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  enhanced due diligence is required to verify the suitability and security of the approved premises

actionablerules.obligation: A licensed person or ultimate owner must notify the Commission in writing of any change in any information that has been provided to the Commission within 7 business days
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Licensed VA providers and ultimate owners
risksignalstomonitor: Delayed or missing notifications of changes in ownership, contact details, or business address
Inconsistent information between the register and the providers records
Failure to update the register after a change
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Written notification form with details of the change
Supporting documents eg, updated ID, address proof
Confirmation receipt from the Commission
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  standard notification procedures apply, but the Commission may review the change for fit and proper compliance

actionablerules.obligation: A licensed provider must submit a written notice to the Commission within 7 business days before it intends to cease providing any VA service for which it is licensed
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Licensed providers
risksignalstomonitor: Planned cessation of a VA service
Unusual or abrupt changes in service offerings
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Written notice to the Commission
Full description of the intended cessation
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  any cessation may alter the providers risk profile and requires review of client exposure

actionablerules.obligation: A licensed provider must notify the Commission in writing at least 7 business days in advance if it intends to change the address at which it proposes to provide any VA service
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Licensed providers
risksignalstomonitor: Change of business address
Relocation to highrisk jurisdictions
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Written notice to the Commission
Updated address details
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  address changes can affect jurisdictional risk and client asset protection

actionablerules.obligation: Within 7 business days after a person becomes or ceases to be a director of a licensed provider, both the person and the licensed provider must notify the Commission in writing of the name, address, and nature of the position
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Licensed providers and new or departing directors
risksignalstomonitor: Director changes
Potential conflicts of interest
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Written notice to the Commission
Directors personal details and role description
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  director changes can impact governance and risk management

actionablerules.obligation: An associated entity of a licensed provider must notify the Commission in writing within 7 business days after it becomes or ceases to be such an entity, and must provide all particulars specified in Schedule 3D
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Associated entities of licensed providers
risksignalstomonitor: Formation or dissolution of an associated entity
Changes in ownership or control
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Written notice to the Commission
Schedule 3D particulars eg, entity details, ownership structure
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  associated entities can be conduits for money laundering or fraud

actionablerules.obligation: An associated entity of a licensed provider must not, at any time after becoming such an entity, conduct any business other than receiving or holding client assets of the licensed provider unless expressly authorized in writing by the Commission
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Associated entities of licensed providers
risksignalstomonitor: Unapproved business activities
Diversification into unrelated services
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Commission authorization if any
Internal policy confirming restricted activities
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  deviation from permitted activities signals potential misuse of client assets

actionablerules.obligation: A licensed provider must appoint an eligible auditor within 1 month after it becomes licensed and notify the Commission in writing of the auditors name and address within 7 business days of the appointment
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Licensed providers
risksignalstomonitor: Failure to appoint an auditor
Delayed auditor appointment
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Appointment letter of the auditor
Written notice to the Commission
Compliance with eligibility criteria Section 53ZSA
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  this is a standard compliance requirement, but audit quality should be monitored

actionablerules.obligation: Collect a valid business registration certificate, a declaration that the precious metals and stones business will be carried out for a lawful purpose, written consent from all occupants of any domestic premises to be used as business premises, and the prescribed application fee when a person applies for Category A registration
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Applicants for Category A registration
risksignalstomonitor: Missing or incomplete business registration certificate
No written consent from premises occupants
Failure to declare lawful purpose
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Business registration certificate
Declaration of lawful purpose
Written consent from premises occupants
Proof of fee payment
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  the applicant must undergo a fitandproper assessment, including checks for criminal convictions, bankruptcy, and compliance with regulatory conditions

actionablerules.obligation: Perform a fitandproper assessment for each individual applicant, partner, director or ultimate owner, checking for convictions of specified offences, overseas convictions for money laundering or terrorist financing, failure to comply with regulatory requirements, undischarged bankruptcy, and liquidation or windingup status
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Individuals, partners, directors, ultimate owners of Category A or B registrants
risksignalstomonitor: Criminal convictions related to financial crime
Overseas convictions for money laundering or terrorism financing
Undischarged bankruptcy filings
Liquidation or windingup orders
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Criminal record checks
Bankruptcy and insolvency records
Regulatory compliance history
Fitandproper assessment report
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  the assessment is a form of Enhanced Due Diligence EDD required by the ordinance

actionablerules.obligation: Cancel or suspend a Category A or B registration if the registrant contravenes any registration condition, fails to pay the annual fee, fails to comply with remedial orders, or if circumstances suggest the business is being carried out for an unlawful purpose
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Registered Category A and Category B precious metals and stones dealers
risksignalstomonitor: Nonpayment of annual fee
Failure to comply with remedial orders
Evidence of unlawful business purpose
Revocation of premises occupant consent
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Payment records for annual fee
Compliance reports on remedial orders
Internal audit findings on business purpose
Premises occupant consent records
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  standard compliance monitoring is sufficient

actionablerules.obligation: Obtain written approval from the Commissioner before a person becomes an ultimate owner or partner of a Category B registrant, and ensure that the person satisfies the fitandproper test
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Prospective ultimate owners and partners of Category B registrants
risksignalstomonitor: Unapproved ultimate owners or partners
Individuals with disqualifying criminal or financial history
Lack of written approval documentation
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Written approval from the Commissioner
Fitandproper assessment report
Documentation of ultimate ownership or partnership status
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  the approval process includes EDD to assess the ultimate owner or partner

actionablerules.obligation: Prohibit any person who is not a registered Category A or B dealer from carrying out specified transactions or claiming to be a registrant, and monitor for false claims of registration
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Nonregistered persons and entities
risksignalstomonitor: Claims of registration status by nonregistered parties
Unregistered individuals carrying out specified transactions
Advertising or marketing that implies registration
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Verification of registration status against the register
Monitoring of marketing materials and communications
Internal reporting of suspected nonregistered activity
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  this is a compliance monitoring rule

actionablerules.obligation: Obtain written approval from the Commissioner before appointing a director to a Category B registrant that is a corporation
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Corporations that are Category B registrants
risksignalstomonitor: Appointment of a director without prior written approval
Director with a history of financial crime or unfit background
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Completed application form as specified by the Commissioner
Fee payment receipt as per Schedule 3K
Fit and proper assessment report of the director
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes, because the directors suitability must be assessed as a fit and proper person

actionablerules.obligation: Submit all applications for director approval in the form and manner specified by the Commissioner and pay the required fee
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All entities applying for director approval under sections 53ZUW, 53ZUX or 53ZUY
risksignalstomonitor: Missing or incomplete application forms
Failure to pay the prescribed fee
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Application form in the prescribed format
Proof of fee payment
actionablerules.requiresedd: No

actionablerules.obligation: Display the certificate of registration in a conspicuous place at the principal place of business and at each branch
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All registrants, including those operating electronically
risksignalstomonitor: Absence of a physical display of the certificate
Electronic certificate not accompanied by a printed copy
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Certificate of registration printed copy
Photographic evidence of display
actionablerules.requiresedd: No

actionablerules.obligation: Notify the Commissioner in writing within one month of any change in specified particulars, such as ownership or control
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All registrants
risksignalstomonitor: Delayed or missing notifications of changes
Changes in ultimate ownership or control without notification
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Written notification to the Commissioner
Updated registration certificate if applicable
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes, if the change involves ownership or control, a review of the new owners suitability is required

actionablerules.obligation: Provide written notice to the Commissioner before the intended date of cessation of business or specified transactions
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Category A and Category B registrants
risksignalstomonitor: Failure to notify cessation in advance
Sudden cessation of business without prior notice
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Written cessation notice specifying intended date
Confirmation of receipt by the Commissioner
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes, because cessation may indicate a change in risk profile and requires assessment of remaining obligations

actionablerules.obligation: Comply with any disciplinary order issued by the Commissioner, including remedial actions and payment of pecuniary penalties
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Category A and Category B registrants
risksignalstomonitor: Noncompliance with remedial actions
Repeated contraventions of regulatory conditions
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Written notice of disciplinary order
Evidence of remedial action taken or payment of penalty
actionablerules.requiresedd: No

actionablerules.obligation: Maintain confidentiality of information obtained under the Ordinance and not disclose it to unauthorized persons
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Specified persons, including relevant authorities and their employees
risksignalstomonitor: Unauthorized disclosure of confidential information
Failure to secure sensitive documents
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Confidentiality agreements
Access logs and security controls
actionablerules.requiresedd: No

actionablerules.obligation: Identify the customer and verify the customers identity using reliable documents, data or information from a governmental body, relevant authority, or a recognized digital identification system before establishing a business relationship
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All customers of financial institutions and DNFBPs, including TCSP licensees and Category B PMS registrants
risksignalstomonitor: Customer fails to provide valid identification documents
Customers information is inconsistent with public records
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Government-issued ID identity card, passport, etc
Proof of address
Digital ID verification if available
actionablerules.requiresedd: No, this is standard CDD

actionablerules.obligation: Identify and verify the beneficial owners of a customer who is a legal person or trust, ensuring the institution knows who ultimately owns or controls more than 25 of the entity
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Customers that are corporations, partnerships, trusts, or other legal persons
risksignalstomonitor: Ownership structure is opaque or complex
Beneficial owner is a highrisk jurisdiction or PEP
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Certificate of incorporation or registration
Shareholder register
Trust deed or partnership agreement
Beneficial ownership declaration
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes, if the beneficial owner is a PEP or from a highrisk jurisdiction

actionablerules.obligation: Carry out CDD before any occasional transaction of 120,000 or more, or any wirevirtual asset transfer of 8,000 or more, unless the customer is a preexisting customer with prior CDD
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All customers, including preexisting ones, for transactions meeting the thresholds
risksignalstomonitor: Large or multiple linked transactions
Transactions involving highrisk jurisdictions
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Transaction details and source of funds
Customer identification records
Beneficial owner verification if applicable
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes, if the transaction involves a PEP, highrisk jurisdiction, or suspicious patterns

actionablerules.obligation: Apply Enhanced Due Diligence EDD for customers who are PEPs, have a highrisk source of wealth, or are from a highrisk jurisdiction, including additional verification of source of funds and wealth
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: PEPs, former PEPs, customers from highrisk jurisdictions, and customers with complex ownership structures
risksignalstomonitor: Publicly known PEP status
Highrisk jurisdiction of residence or business
Unusual or large source of funds
requireddocumentsorcontrols: PEP declaration and supporting evidence
Detailed source of wealth documentation
Periodic review and monitoring reports
Senior management approval
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes, mandatory for all identified highrisk customers

actionablerules.obligation: Continuously monitor the business relationship by reviewing customer information, scrutinizing transactions for unusual patterns, and documenting findings
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All customers, with heightened focus on highrisk and preexisting customers
risksignalstomonitor: Complex or unusually large transactions
Transactions with no apparent economic purpose
Changes in customers account activity or ownership
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Periodic review logs
Transaction monitoring system alerts
Written findings and action plans
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes, if monitoring reveals new highrisk indicators

actionablerules.obligation: For customers not physically present for identification, perform at least one additional verification measure such as a secondary ID check, supplementary information verification, or ensure the first payment is made through an account opened in the customers name with a compliant institution
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Customers who are not physically present for identification
risksignalstomonitor: Lack of physical presence
Use of remote or digital identification only
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Secondary ID documents
Supplementary verification data
Confirmation of account opening with a compliant institution
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes, if the customer is also a PEP or from a highrisk jurisdiction

actionablerules.obligation: Collect and record the originators account number or unique reference, originators address, identification number or dateplace of birth, recipients name, and recipients account number or unique reference for every wire transfer of 8,000 or more
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All ordering institutions processing domestic or foreign wire transfers of 8,000 or more
risksignalstomonitor: Transfers above the threshold without complete originatorrecipient details
Large singleday volume of highvalue transfers
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Wire transfer instruction form with required fields
Customer identification documents ID card, passport, etc
Internal audit log confirming data capture
Approval from senior management for each highvalue transfer
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  EDD is required for any transfer where the originator or recipient is a politically exposed person, a known or suspected moneylaundering suspect, or a foreign entity with limited regulatory oversight

actionablerules.obligation: For wire transfers below 8,000, collect and record the originators account number or unique reference, originators address, recipients name, and recipients account number or unique reference
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All ordering institutions processing domestic or foreign wire transfers below 8,000
risksignalstomonitor: Frequent lowvalue transfers that aggregate to large amounts
Transfers to or from highrisk jurisdictions
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Wire transfer instruction form with required fields
Customer identification records
Transaction monitoring system flagging aggregation of lowvalue transfers
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  standard due diligence suffices unless other highrisk indicators are present

actionablerules.obligation: If a beneficiary or intermediary institution receives a wire transfer lacking any required information, it must obtain the missing data from the ordering institution within three business days and, if unavailable, either restrictterminate the relationship or implement reasonable AMLTFT mitigation measures
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All beneficiary and intermediary institutions receiving wire transfers
risksignalstomonitor: Missing or incomplete originatorrecipient data
Requests for information that are denied or delayed
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Written request for missing information
Record of response time and action taken
Documentation of any relationship restriction or mitigation steps
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  EDD is required if the missing information relates to a highrisk jurisdiction or a knownsuspected moneylaundering suspect

actionablerules.obligation: Apply enhanced due diligence for any customer or beneficial owner that is a politically exposed person, a known or suspected moneylaundering suspect, or a customer from a highrisk jurisdiction, including sourceofwealth verification and ongoing monitoring
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All customers, beneficial owners, and highrisk counterparties
risksignalstomonitor: Political exposure, public office, or close associates
Large or irregular cash deposits
Transactions involving highrisk countries
requireddocumentsorcontrols: PEP declaration and verification documents
Sourceofwealth statements
Enhanced transaction monitoring rules
Periodic review reports
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  EDD is mandatory for all identified highrisk categories

actionablerules.obligation: Maintain original or copies of all documents and records related to each transaction and customer for at least five years, and keep customer files throughout the business relationship plus five years after termination
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All financial institutions and DNFBPs
risksignalstomonitor: Missing or incomplete record retention
Failure to retain records beyond the statutory period
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Secure electronic database or microfilm storage
Retention schedule and audit trail
Periodic internal audits of recordkeeping compliance
actionablerules.requiresedd: No  this is a standard recordkeeping requirement

actionablerules.obligation: Before establishing a correspondent banking relationship with a foreign institution, collect sufficient information on the institutions business, reputation, supervision quality, and AMLTFT controls obtain senior management approval and document responsibilities for both parties
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All authorized institutions entering correspondent banking relationships
risksignalstomonitor: Lack of physical presence in the foreign jurisdiction
Poor regulatory supervision or weak AMLTFT controls
Unverified customer due diligence procedures
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Duediligence report on the foreign institution
Senior management approval documentation
Agreements outlining responsibilities and datasharing protocols
Ongoing monitoring plan for the relationship
actionablerules.requiresedd: Yes  EDD is required if the foreign institution is located in a highrisk jurisdiction or has inadequate AMLTFT controls

actionablerules.obligation: Track and record the 12month deemed licensing period for each individual who meets the conditions for deemed licensing
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Individuals who have applied for a VA service licence 53ZRL and accreditation 53ZRM and satisfy all conditions in subsection 1ad
risksignalstomonitor: Application remains pending beyond the 12month period without withdrawal or objection
No recorded start or end date for the deemed licensing period
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Application forms 53ZRL, 53ZRM
Internal log of start date first day of deemed period and end date withdrawal, refusal, or 12month expiry
Automated reminder system to flag when the 12month period is approaching
actionablerules.requiresedd: No

actionablerules.obligation: Issue a written notice section 5 or 7 notice to the individual within the first 12 months of the decision on their application
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All individuals whose application decisions are made under sections 5 or 7
risksignalstomonitor: No notice sent within 12 months of decision
Notice sent after the 12month deadline
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Template notice containing decision, reasons, and objection rights
Timestamped electronic delivery record
Audit trail confirming receipt by the individual
actionablerules.requiresedd: No

actionablerules.obligation: Provide a 12month objection period for deemed withdrawal of an application and monitor for objections
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: All applicants whose applications are subject to deemed withdrawal under section 10
risksignalstomonitor: Objection not filed within the 12month period
Objection filed after the 12month deadline
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Record of the date the specified notice was issued
Log of objection receipt and date
Automated reminder to the applicant 30 days before objection deadline
actionablerules.requiresedd: No

actionablerules.obligation: Enforce a 3month closingdown period for corporations after denial, withdrawal, or refusal of a VA service licence
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Corporations whose application for a VA service licence 53ZRK is denied, withdrawn, or refused
risksignalstomonitor: Business continues to operate beyond the 3month closingdown period
No formal cessation notice issued to the corporation
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Closingdown period start date date of notice
End date 12month expiry or 3month period
Cessation confirmation from the corporation
actionablerules.requiresedd: No

actionablerules.obligation: Conduct Enhanced Due Diligence on individuals applying as responsible officers when any of the conditions in subsection 1ad are not fully satisfied
actionablerules.whoitappliesto: Individuals applying for responsible officer approval 53ZRP who do not meet all conditions in subsection 1ad
risksignalstomonitor: Incomplete or missing application documents
Applicant from a highrisk jurisdiction or on a sanctions list
Prior regulatory or criminal history
requireddocumentsorcontrols: Full application package 53ZRL, 53ZRM, 53ZRP
Background check reports sanctions, PEP, adverse media
